numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts a poll.
2. The poll was administered among individuals.
3. Each individual was aged 18-34.
4. No individual lives with at least one parent.
5. The graph displays a percentage of young people.
6. Each young person reaches out to a parent at least once a day or a few times per week.
7. A young person reaches out over text or over the phone or by an in-person visit.
8. The graph shows that women reach out to their parents more often than men.
9. This is true for all communication methods.
10. Men are less likely to visit a parent in person than to communicate by technology.
11. Women are less likely to visit a parent in person than to communicate by technology.
12. I want a secondary graph.
13. The secondary graph displays the average distance between a polled individual and the parents of the individual.
14. Many polled individuals may live far from their parents.
15. If many polled individuals live far from their parents then fewer people visit their parents in person.
16. I will go away to college next year.
17. This graph relates to me.
18. It will be interesting to see how often I call my parents.
19. It will be interesting to see how often my brother calls our parents.
20. The title of the graph is: Parental Communication: Women vs. Men.
